tafsirQuiz.question: What does this verse warn or promise?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: Similarly, the notion of revelation from God the Omniscient and Almighty implies that all its contents must be based on knowledge and wisdom. Furthermore, all the things in the Universe spread out far and near are testimonies to the truth of the Quran’s message
distractors: This verse describes the characteristics of believers
This verse talks about the stories of previous prophets
This verse explains the rules of inheritance

tafsirQuiz.question: What warning or glad tiding is mentioned in Surah Al-Jathiya, Ayah 7?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: Since man does not want to lose his elevated status, he does not accept the Truth. But, not bowing down before the Truth amounts to a refusal to bow down before God
distractors: This verse describes the characteristics of believers
This verse explains the rules of inheritance
This verse talks about the stories of previous prophets

tafsirQuiz.question: Which important teaching is conveyed in this ayah?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: We assume that the existing structure of the universe is unique and that it has taken its final shape. The universe has been created in such a way that it is completely subservient to man’s interests
distractors: This verse gives rulings on trade and commerce

tafsirQuiz.question: What does this verse warn or promise?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: The value of the preacher’s efforts is not assessed on the basis of the number of persons he has influenced and brought on to the path of Truth. Those who do not firmly believe that the Day of Judgement is going to dawn on them, venture to oppress others
distractors: This verse explains the rules of inheritance
This verse describes the characteristics of believers
This verse talks about the stories of previous prophets

tafsirQuiz.question: What warning or glad tiding is mentioned in Surah Al-Jathiya, Ayah 16?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: According to verse 16, God exalted the Children of Israel over the peoples of the world. In principle, the Children of Israel were commanded to convey the message to the whole world, as is now the case with the Muslims
distractors: This verse discusses the creation of the universe
This verse talks about the stories of previous prophets
This verse explains the rules of inheritance

tafsirQuiz.question: What consequence is described in this ayah?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: The fact is that man’s inherent nature and the vast universe around him both completely nullify the concept by which life is treated as being so purposeless as not to lead to any significant outcome

This verse explains the rules of inheritance

tafsirQuiz.question: What does this verse warn or promise?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: His eyes look at the Truth, but fail to learn a lesson from it. God has made man’s power of reasoning the entrance gate for guidance
distractors: This verse explains the rules of inheritance
This verse describes the characteristics of believers
This verse talks about the stories of previous prophets

tafsirQuiz.question: What key concept does this verse highlight?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: However, whatever he says is based on conjecture and not on any real knowledge. This is an indication of the fact that, just as life appeared after death-like non-existence for the first time, similarly, for the second time also, there will be life after death

tafsirQuiz.question: Which important teaching is conveyed in this ayah?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: Those who, in this world, rise with the Message of God, do so, in fact, on the basis of Truth; and those who stand up on any other basis, do so, in fact, on the basis of falsehood

tafsirQuiz.question: What does this verse warn or promise?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: This record will be so supremely real that it will not be possible for anybody to deny its correctness. Having one’s deeds ‘written down’ does not mean having them written with pen and ink in the usual sense; it means rather having one’s deeds recorded

tafsirQuiz.question: What warning or glad tiding is mentioned in Surah Al-Jathiya, Ayah 30?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: While the wrath of God will descend upon the former, the latter will be blessed by the grace of God. But it will be clear on the Day of Judgement that these attempts stemmed from a sinful mentality and not from a Truth-loving mind
distractors: This verse describes the characteristics of believers

tafsirQuiz.question: What consequence is described in this ayah?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: In the Hereafter, man will accept the Truth which he denied in this world. In the present world when a man commits evil, its bad results do not at once appear before him
distractors: This verse discusses the creation of the universe
This verse talks about the stories of previous prophets

tafsirQuiz.question: What is the main message of Surah Al-Jathiya, Ayah 36?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: Nobody can seriously venture to assume anybody except God to be the Creator and Lord of the universe. So, its Creator and Lord must also be one who is of unlimited greatness: this mighty being cannot be anyone except the one and only God
distractors: This verse talks about the Day of Judgment only
This verse is about the battles of early Muslims
